Reviews.Title: “A great aparthotel in a good area.”
Reviews.Author: Roy Little
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona and stayed at the Aparthotel Calabria. The hotel was ideally placed in Barcelona for access from the airport shuttle bus. Literally 7 minutes walk from Placa Espanya. The neighbourhood is also very safe, even into the small hours. The reception staff were very polite & helpful, as well as all speaking perfect English. The rooms were very good, and to be honest the only problem I had with noise was my mate snoring through the night. Every chance he kept half the hotel up! Breakfasts, as mentioned were very good, with an extensive choice of cold foods, and standard hot food in scrambled eggs, bacon and suasage. The cost of the hotel was very good, and I would not hesitate in using it again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah-jane a
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 7 days in march 2012,it was a fantastic location and handy for everywhere.it was more than value for money and frankly i cant see how it could get a bad reveiw!!!some people expect too much.the rooms were always cleaned and were spacious and ok there wasnt many english speaking tv but do you really expect that!!!!some people have commented on the noise but both myself and husband never found it an issue and slept extremly well.the staff were always helpful and spoke excellent english.breakfast was simple but more than adequate and my husband enjoyed the pasteries too much lol.overall if we were yo travel to barcelona again i would without a doubt stay here

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: MHYAM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights, but as previous reviews have mentioned, noise is an issue here. the walls are literally paper thin and it is very difficult to sleep. the doors were also very noisy. Location is quite good, only a couple of stops away from La Ramblas and with supermarkets and stores nearby. Could do with more then one english channel on tv. Overall was ok thats all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the center”
Reviews.Author: Rene8839
Reviews.Content: Our room was very good, clean and comfortable. The hotel is near to the center and subway. Staff was friendly. I can recommend this hotel for its good location, services and valuable price.

Reviews.Title: “great night sleep”
Reviews.Author: ali k
Reviews.Content: a fantastic nights sleep in a fancy bed, the bedroom was full of everything that you need, even a hairdryer

Reviews.Title: “Functionally, very nearly perfect.”
Reviews.Author: ExiledNorthamptonian
Reviews.Content: But, maybe not if you want to sleep at night. This apparthotel has a lot to offer, especially for families. Each room is spacious (35m²), and has a kitchenette. The location is about 2 minutes walk from the Rocafort metro stop on line 1. There are 2 supermarkets almost next door, and numerous cafés and restarants, delicatessens, and what have you in the immediate neighbourhood. Apart from the Line 1 metro, there are 4 TMB (barcelona metro area transports) buses. It's possible to walk to Plaça d'Espanya and even Barcelona Sants Railway station is walkable (10<>15 mins)(We're arrived by train from France). The staff are very helpful, and speak at least English and French, as well as Spanish (Don't forget that barcelona is catalunya, and Catalan is the language, it's kind of mix of spanish and french, pretty easy to understand when read, in any case, if you know French and/or Spanish) The breakfast buffet was ordinary, and during our stay during school holiday period, was packed with screaming kids. we decided to have breakfast in the room because of the noise and because of the poor quality of the breakfast. We weren't charged for the 1 morning we had breakfast, maybe itwas included in the rate. If it is/was then it's acceptable, but not for the 8€ per person suplement advertised. Really, the only really bad point about the hotels were the thin walls, and hearing even quiet conversations from the neighbouring room very clearly. I had to phone reception one night because I couldn't sleep. If you want to sleeep, then you take a risk,because it depends on how you sleep through noise and how noisy, or not, your neghbours are. I don't like to exagerrate, but seriously, the neighbours didn't have to be rowdy to be able to hear them, the walls are very thin! If they fixed the noise problem, then this hotel would be worth 5 points.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel well connected quite cheap”
Reviews.Author: ted k
Reviews.Content: Please ask for a room on a last stage - from balcon You will get brilliant view on the old Barcelona. There is small table so as 2 chairs outside - ideal for speding evening with glass of wine looking on city at night. The appartment its ok, with quite big main room and small kitchen. Brakefast - its a mix of continental and typical spanish one. For that amount of money its ok. Its not 4 stars hotel, but for a short stay 3-4 nights its ok. Advantage not far away from city center. Hotel is gread connected just 2 minutes form metro station and around 20-25 minutes nice wallk into La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: valerielynne
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from Barcelona after spending 4 nights at this hotel. Very impressed by the size of the studio and how well equipped it was. It is about 20 -30 minutes walk from the Ramblas and only 20 minutes from the Sans railway station. We found it easier to walk it than take 2 metro trains. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful especially the lady in the dining room. Free internet and printing was a nice bonus. We didn't find it noisy at all as somebody suggested. Breakfast was very nice but started to get a bit boring seeing exactly the same everyday. They could do with varying it a bit. I would definitely recommend it and stay there again next time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and not bad location - but noisy...”
Reviews.Author: LondonJandJ
Reviews.Content: We booked this on the strength of TripAdvisor reviews and because it seemed less of a rip-off than most other Barcelona hotels. We found that it's good for families (like us - with a 2yr old) the fact it had capacity for 4 people, also that it had a kitchenette (even if you don't cook it's useful to have a fridge for baby milk etc). The rooms was a bit dated if you were being picky but fit for purpose. Bathroom had a good powerful shower and was clean. Location, while you can't pretend it's really central, was not bad especially in relation to Place de Espanya (Magic Fountain etc) and Sants station which was where we arrived and departed the city. For La Rambla, Placa de Catalunya etc we took the metro a few stops - same for Sagrada Familia although that is a bit out of the centre anyway so you'll always have to take the metro. Area around hotel is fine, not touristy which is good, we ate tapas round the corner which was perfectly nice. Supermarket next door is very useful. Breakfast plentiful and tasty. There is a little play corner in the lounge for young kids (has puzzles, books, building blocks etc) which is a nice touch. Reception staff speak English and were nice enough though we didn't have to test them by complaining or anything! So the main bad point about the hotel/apartments was the noise - not from outside, as it's a quiet area a little off the beaten track - but from other rooms. We were woken early in the morning by neighbouring rooms singing, talking etc, and people above us walking up and down. I guess you often get this in hotels but it was annoying as you sometimes want to be lazy on holiday and not get up at work time! That was the only thing which would make us think twice about booking again... that and the fact that you can't lock the room door from the inside and the lock generally seemed flimsy. I think if you had a mind to, you could probably get into the rooms without too much difficulty. Though maybe I'm being paranoid. Just found it weird there was no bolt or similar on the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travelers574
Reviews.Content: We found this place to be in a great location and served our needs very well. It was nice to have a kitchenette, even though it was small it had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable and it was a treat to have a flat screen TV and have internet service available in the hotel. The balcony is small but it was nice to be able to look out and feel like you lived there. Having the supermarket next door was fabulous, nice to be able to pick up a warm baguette when we got back from our sightseeing and it cut our food bill considerably. We walked to both the plazas frequently, used the wonderful Metro. Breakfast was available every morning for 8 Euros and it was excellent and good value, also they had a communal room with fresh pastries, coffee, tea and water. We would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean & spacious.”
Reviews.Author: Aquasky2878
Reviews.Content: I had a very spacious room, with kitchen , seating area and a balcony. It was at the back of the building but with a nice view of the surroundings. Quite clean and spacious bathroom. In general you got all comforts to stay more than a week. The location is also good, although not very close to the Ramblas or Bari Gottic, there is a metro station very close...In general a quite nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: PriDotCom
Reviews.Content: This apartment block is not as close to the attractions as it makes out BUT it is only a short train ride away from everything you need to see!! Not much to see or do around the hotel itself, but we wanted a comfortable, clean place to put our heads down and that is what we got! The apartment has great facilities! The kitchen has a hob, pans, cutlery and crockery, a microwave and a fridge. There is also a communal room whith PC and they put out a pastry spread for breakfast!! I would wholly recommend this apartment!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: lexurer Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Very large and clean room. Quite central. 5 mins from 2 metro stations. Very good breakfast. Quite fast wifi internet. Very good choice for a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but dirty room”
Reviews.Author: MassR
Reviews.Content: Overall the Atenea Calabria is rather OK for the price you pay. The location is good, in the Eixample district with a lot of connections to the centre. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is quite simple but not bad. The rooms/apartments are quite large and even though not trendy nor cosy, still comfortable. Two negative aspects though: the cleanliness of the room (found used cigarettes under the bed as well as quite some dirt on the floor) and the noise from the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good location, staff and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: VlaSerb
Reviews.Content: Our first impression was not so brilliant, because of the funny smell that hotel had, but as days were passing by we were more and more satisfied. Rooms are big and clean (not very modern and new, but that was not important for us at all), location is great - just 5min walk from plaza Espanya and 10min walk from Plaza Catalunya (ofcourse, it is even closer by Metro - station is 200 meters away), also there is a nice supermarket next to the Hotel and hotel staff was always friendly and pleasent, especially ladies at the breakfast :)) breakfast was always good and fresh! the only minus for the hotel, besides that funny smell, were very very thin walls! thanks God we didn't have loud neighbours! :) in general - very good hotel for that price (500eur - 7 days, for two persons)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: masny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good in a good location. Our room was very spacious with all facilities. The breakfast was delicious and fresh. Proper attention was given to cleanliness. Everything was very neat and tidy. Room service was proper . The stay was very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment, great staff, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: chart54
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed here in September 2010. We thought the apartment was great and enough for our needs although the kitchen could have had a microwave and a few more utensils. No kettle, but took my own. View from our apartment was of back and could see art musuem & olympic monument in distance. Breakfast was good, hotel clean & receptionists were very helpful. Supermarket next door, and a spar shop across the road. Close to the metro for getting round city; recommend buying a T-10 ticket as lasts for 10 journeys & cheap and was enough for our 4 day stay.. Aerobus (cheap & frequent ) stops at placa de espanya some 15 minutes walk away from hotel. Safe to walk around this area at night. A must is to go up to art musuem & see city at night some 25 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very good unpretentious hotel”
Reviews.Author: BaldEagleHarrogate
Reviews.Content: Very good rooms with a small kitchen area, and bed and sitting areas separated by a room divider. Excellent, friendly and helpful Reception staff. Good location. Walking distance (less than 10 minutes) to Placa Espanya for a short trip(only 3 stops) to main Exhibition Centre(Fira Gran Via) with a further small Centre(Fira Montjuic) at Espanya itself. Going the other way it is 3 short stops to Placa Catalunya and the top of The Ramblas. Some restaurants nearby but ask Reception for a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “It's worth it!”
Reviews.Author: GoesAroundTheWorld
Reviews.Content: The room that we had was big enough. It looked as a small apartment. There were a small functional kitchen with all necessary dishes. Near the hotel was a small supermarket with fresh seafood. The furniture looked quite old, but it creates a good atmosphere of early 90th. The room has a nice view from window. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was always tasty and fresh. I'd never eaten as much as we ate there ;) It was so delicious. The staff was really friendly. The hotel is located quite far from the center and the sea. It needs to go there by subway or bus. I can recommend this hotel for people who would have a car there or who doesn't mind to walk about 20 minutes to the center, otherwise it's better to find the hotel near the center.

Reviews.Title: “A more than adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: BomberMold
Reviews.Content: I took my two daughters aged 22 and 26 for a 3 day break. The room was large with a partition down the middle which allowed for privacy. I didn't notice any undue noise at all. The beakfast was very good. Only problem was after we had left the hotel we were chased down the road and told we hadn't paid. I explained we had paid with Travel Republic so I hope he sorted it out. The metro is brilliant and used it all the time. Loved the city and look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Sergey_xxx
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect: 20 minutes walking distance from busy Las Ramblas or just few stops to the city centre. Room was huge with fridge and kitchen. I can't say that furniture was modern, it looks quite old. And about breakfast: great, it was delicious!!! fabulous !!! Staff was friendly. There was no hair-dryer in the room, but we got it on front desk. Good supermarket near the hotel. Maybe sometimes I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mattlyon
Reviews.Content: Clean place, walking distance from Metro but a bit far from town center. The rooms are large but a bit old-fashioned, beds are not of good quality. Little kitchen, but with very few dishes. Biggest problem is noise ; it is very very noisy, you hear what your neighbours do, say, when they walk, etc... and there is a lot of activity at night. Despite what's written in the description, no hairdryer available (if you're lucky you'll be able to borrow one at the reception, if there is one left), no safe, no iron. And no table to eat on, so you'll only be able to prepare a light meal for lunch out for instance. When checking out, check your bill, they tried to charge me 80 € for laundry, but I never used this service ! Not so bad value-for-money, but could be better.

Reviews.Title: “good location for sights , friendly , renovated to good standard”
Reviews.Author: PeterCUk
Reviews.Content: We booked this for one night following a cruise so that we could have a look around Barcelona , it is on a side street off the Grand Via , the first impression of the street was a bit scruffy but I think that a lot of streets are like this in the centre of the city. The hotel / apartments are in an old building but have been renovated with marble floors , sinks etc , the lobby area is nice if smallish. They have a left luggage room that is basically the room that housed the electricity meters and other supplies , but it did the purpose , we arrived at 10am in the morning saturday and left the bags all day till we got back from sightseeing at 7pm when we checked in properly , the next day after checking out we left the bags until 5pm when we went to the airport. Although some sites call it a hotel some rooms are apartments , ours had a double bed then wardrobe and an open shelf unit that seperated it from the sofabed and balcony , it had a basic kitchen with fridge and 2 hotplates , breakfast was good, hot and cold buffet another reviewer who was very helpful to us said to get the city tour bus from the plaza espana which we did but this is a very busy stop so aniother place may be better - get a map when you buy a ticket - 22 euros 1 day 29 euros 3 days - use on all 3 routes red blue and green , well worth doing. we were mindful of pickpockets when in busy places but nearly got caught out by a hustle , there were a number of what looked like students with clipboards wanting us to sign a petition on behalf of dumb people - one approached my wife and one myself so we were slightly separated , I wasn't sure wether to sign , and the girl with me started getting very pushy about it which I din't like , them my wife shouted NO GET OFF , so I moved there and pushed the lad away from her , he had partly covered her handbag with the clipboard and managed to unzip it she spotted it so shouted . we were very lucky we lost nothing but it was close - the thieves disappeared very quickly probably to another area - loads of police around but not very effective.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MichaelNieuwegein
Reviews.Content: Like previous reviewer : the apartment (sleeps four people) has all amenities ; good beds ; basic kitchen (and a supermarket just next door) ; good and quiet location (5 minutes walk to metro-station and 15-20 minutes walk to Plaza Catalunia and also 15-20 minutes walk (in the opposite direction, to Saints train/busstation and Plaza Espana/Singing Fountain); free wireless internet in the room ; good showers ; nice breakfast buffet and kind staff. I booked through the web and payed a very reasonable 65 Euro per night (3 adults). On the downside : the rooms might be a little noisy, especially if the hotel is full (which was not the case when we stayed here, in February) and the kitchen had a very unpleasant odeur.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: kfalcione
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed in a triple room at this hotel in July. Great, friendly, knowledgeable staff were always present, the breakfast was plentiful (even though most days we missed it because we slept through the time alotted). Hotel is very close to restaurants, shops and the Metro station. Supermarket right next door has everything you may need. Safe location and pretty central to everything we wanted to see. The room was very clean, large enough for the 3 of us and the kitchenette was a welcome addition for late night snacking. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying there again. I booked though Travelocity.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and a fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: groovefacilitator
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews on here and there seemed to be quite a few negative comments but on a budget we had to take what we could afford. The sat nav took us straight there and we were checked in very quickly and efficiently. We were expecting a small room so when we found what we had been allocated we we over the moon. The room comprised of four sections: bathroom with a bath, kitchen with hot plate and microwave, bed room with aircon and lastly a lounge with a balcony. The room was spotlessly clean, the bed was comfy, the room had blackout blinds so it was nice and dark. Wonderful. Breakfast was great - after 2 weeks of continental breakfasts it was nice to see bacon and eggs :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: UKHolidayAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid August 2009. Bad points about this hotel is noise, noise and noise. Noise came from next-door rooms (TV and people chatting) as the walls are very thin. Noise came from drilling taking place in the ground floor shops which started at around 8.30 am and was really bad. To make it worse the air con unit was making strange noise every couple of minutes that kept waking me up and I had to turn it off. I complained about the drilling noise but reception pretended it wasn’t happening and they started talking about repair work in hotel that they said it was over, whereas I later saw the drilling in the shops on the ground floor. Reception staff are on the grumpy side and not nice (somehow always eating meals at the reception desk). The hotel furniture is so old to the point that it can’t be sold in a second hand market. The hotel good points are good space, decent bed, good location, free internet computer with printer (2nd floor) and cleanness. The room, bathroom and the kitchenette (sink, fridge and 2 electric hobs) are spotlessly clean. There is a safe in the room that you need to get its key after paying 5 euros deposit. It is located 3 metro stops from the very heart of Barcelona. The nearest metro station is Rocafort, which is 3-5 minutes walk from the hotel. You can actually walk to the city centre but that can take 20-30 minutes. It is also a walking distance 15 minutes to Sants station to catch regional trains. The area is nice and safe and there are a couple of good supermarkets in the same building. Will I stay here again? No, I’ll try to avoid it and find something better (noiseless).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: TJdogdygo
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Very close to Rocafort metro stop. It is only 6 blocks to Espanya, where you can take a bus straight to airport. There is also a supermarket next to the hotel. The shops around the hotel also opens late. We had a 3 person room. The room was nice, clean and lots of space. The only down side is that the bathroom door doesn't close all the way. But I would go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshine379
Reviews.Content: My partner and 21 month old stayed here for 5 nights. This was a spacious and very clean hotel and very close to the Metro and in the middle of a busy town. There are two supermarkets next door; the second one is a bit more of a discount place so look there first. We had a good sized double bed, a good sized living area and a TV. Also a balcony and a small kitchen area with 2 hobs a fridge, 2 pots and a frying pan, plates, cutlery and cups. There is no kettle or microwave, so if you have children who drink formula milk you may have to get a kettle out there or use the pots instead. The staff at the front desk all spoke English, gave us a map and highlighted the top sightseeing destinations on arrival. Some were friendlier than others but on the whole the staff were polite. There is a breakfast buffet in the morning with quite a good selection, eggs, bacon, toast cereal tea juice, fruit, pastry etc. We choose this hotel because it was supposed to be child friendly, but they put us on the 5th floor and any industrious child can easily open the balcony door as the handles are so low. They do have high chairs (but these have no straps) but on the plus side they do have a travel cot. If I were to grumble I would say that the floors were marble and quite cold and the lifts seem to like to trap any available body part each time you use it. But I would probably stay there again mainly because of the location, and kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Wis_Travler
Reviews.Content: Everything was very clean and nice in our room and at the hotel. The breakfast was included and plentyful with staff on hand to replenish things. My two sisters and I stayed for 6 nights in a triple room which was supplied with more than enough shampoo and shower gel. They also included sponges, razors and toothbrushes but no face clothes. Your choice if you want new towels daily. The area was very safe even at night. There is a grocery store next door but not open on Sundays. The metro is 2 block away and ATM's are located in any direction from the hotel. All of Barcelona seems to be very safe but always watch your belonings and keep you purse near as there are many people that will pick your pockets especialy in the metro and on the Rambles, we didn't have any problems but did wittness theivery. I booked my stay through Venere.com

Reviews.Title: “Good honest hotel”
Reviews.Author: em1234
Reviews.Content: A good honest hotel. Nice location near Metro, and plenty of cafes or restaurants nearby. Good breakfast. The small kitchen area was handy to prepare drinks and snacks. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Varyou
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very close to metro and bus stops. Supermarket next door. Clean, spacious rooms, comfy beds. Small but smart bathroom. Abundant breakfast buffet. Small kitchenette with some plates and cutlery. No microwave, no teatowel or detergent. Electric kettle would be welcome. We reserved the apartment for three, but we had to repeatedly ask for bedlinen and towels for the 3rd person. Once our room door (next to elevator) was left open by the maid. I must admit, nothing has disappeared from the room. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: LauraSpain
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lovely surprise. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The apartment was spotlessly clean, large, well appointed with balcony, and had airconditioning as standard. It was very central to everything and the metro was just around the corner - Rocafort. The breakfast also was a nice surprise, hot and plenty of it as long as you get down before 9.30!! I would recommend it highly to old, young and families. Will be booking it again next time I'm up there.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JRAC17
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Otel.com for a weekend's stay in Barcelona and got a good deal. The room was very basic, but the big plus was that there was a huge amount of space -- in addition to the bedroom area, there was a large sitting area with couch and desk. There is also a kitchenette if you are inclined to cook. This hotel is not centrally located, but it is convenient to the metro and about 8 blocks from Placa Espanya (Aerobus to airport) and Sants station (train to airport). Hotel staff were courteous at best, not especially friendly or helpful. Do not expect any concierge-type advice from them! Breakfast was good and more extensive than at our hotel in Sitges. There was nothing wrong with this hotel or neighborhood, but for tourists like us I would recommend staying in Ciutat Vella or Barri Gotic areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “wish we had known better”
Reviews.Author: nicole111
Reviews.Content: This was a terrible experience for us. our room was not ready at check in, we had to wait in the lobby for about an hour. When we did get our room it had 2 single beds that could not be converted to a double or pushed together. They could not switch us rooms until 2 days later. No one at the front desk spoke any english. The breakfast was OK, not too much to complain about except the pastry's were a bit dry...like day old pastry. The bathroom was dirty, hair and grunge in the tub. They did not replensish clean towels. I cant remember the exact amount but when we were robbed on the beach they charged us an astronomical amount to replace the room key. The elevator is very old and sounded like it was on its last legs. There is a common tv area, but it seemed to be more of a staff lounge then a place to relax for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable, and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TheAnswer
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Aparthotel Calabria because it was conveniently central to all the places I wanted to see in Barcelona. Just to give you an idea of its location, it was very central to Montjuic, Plaza de Espanya, Camp Nou, and La Rambla. Plus the fact that the metro station was only a block and a half away made it very easy to get around the city. See below for environs. The room was sparsely decorated but nonetheless exceptionally clean. I booked a triple room for 2 nights at 80 euro per night. The room contained 2 twin beds and a couch that converted into a bed. Other furnishings include a desk, phone, tv, nightstand, and kitchenette stocked with pots, pans, glasses, and flatware. The room also had a patio/balcony but the view left much to be desired. The bathroom was immaculate and was generously stocked with amenities including shaving and shoe polish kits. My only qualm with the room was that the heat was not functional. Luckily for us the days were quite warm and the room retained much of that heat throughout the nights. The reception varied throughout the day. At our time of checkin an elder gentleman was seated and looked non too friendly. I paid no mind as I understood the fellow probably knew no English as we knew no Catalan. At other times of the day younger receptionists manned the desk and they were very friendly and always greeted us with a smile. Other amenities include a bagroom where you can leave your bags if you arrive before checkin, and an elevator just in case you're all worn out from the day's travel. The media room had soft lighting, sofas, a 50+ inch plasma tv, and a computer with printer. Even though there was only one computer, getting online was never a problem as not much people were ever in this room. Breakfast was outstanding. Food selection included breads, cheese, ham, sausage, eggs, fruits, juice, coffee, tea, and milk. As mentioned earlier, the hotel is a block and a half from the Rocafort station. Right next to the hotel is a parking garage and a supermarket. An ATM is just around the corner on the same block. A 20 second walk past the metro station along Gran Via takes you to a wonderful Chinese restaurant, and a couple of doors down is a quaint Irish pub where futbol on tv is the main draw. Actually a 15 minute stroll down Gran Via takes you to Plaza de Espanya, which consequently is one of the stops of the airport bus to El Prat. This hotel was a great value. I liked it a lot and so will you.

Reviews.Title: “great review for price and quality of services”
Reviews.Author: falcotravel
Reviews.Content: Good Solution for business and toursim in Barcellona, quite hotel, conformtable, and bir room with cooking inside, also table and chairs for document, cleaning and good breakfast. giovanni Greco

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Cellophane
Reviews.Content: I wholly agree with the previous reviewer. We booked one night through Laterooms.com as somewhere cheap to stay between the airport and the train station. We paid €90 for a room for 3 with breakfast. The room was next to the lift, but as the bathroom and kitchen are between the door and the living area this was not a problem. We didn't use the kitchen, but it could only be described as barely adequate - no microwave, no kettle and few pots and pans. There were a large assortment of toiletries supplied, including shaver, toothbrush and small sponges as well as washing up bits for the kitchen. The breakfast had a huge choice, with bacon, beans, fried and scrambled eggs, breads, croissants and pastries. The room was large, although the third bed took up a lot of space in the sitting area. The only downside, was the distance from the tourist sites. None were in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Well above average 3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: btccfan
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here - the room was good, breakfast was excellent. Generally a good stay. Hotel Location - A medium sized supermarket is to the right of the hotel, several snack bars nearby. The Rocafort metro station is 2 roads to the right, on the grand via. Its a 5-10 minute ride to Placa Catalunya or a 45minute walk. Reception - Spoke good english, very knowledgable staff, booked a taxi for us. Leaflets on tourist atractions in reception. Room - A good size, bedroom area with twin beds and a 'living area' seperated from bedroom by wardrobe with a single bed, sofa and desk. Kitchen had two electric hobs but no oven or microwave or kettle/toaster. Bathroom was fresh and modern, very high standard. Lots of free toilteries too as well as a sowing kit! Some of the furniture is a bit dated but room was spotlessley clean. Breakfast - Good range of hot and cold food served as a buffet. Only downside is not many cereal or fruit. Served in a good sized room. My tips - Very nice staff at supermarket next door - our fave was Carlo Hugo! Not many restaurants nearby so your best off going into the centre to eat.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: spicca63
Reviews.Content: very good location , close to metro station , excellent breakfast large room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: lariojafool
Reviews.Content: We have just left the hotel: Positives: Front desk very helpful Good size of rooms Good location Not too expensive Negatives: Thin walls - we were sometimes woken up by neighbours. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: magnar
Reviews.Content: Nice apt. Clean and well equipped. No wineglasses and no furnitures on the balcony. Just bring the chairs inside out to the balcony. A good advice; send an email to the hotel before leaving - ask for an apt. on the top floor - back side (not against the street). Sun from 10 o'clock in the morning. And specificly ask for a room away from the lift (a bit noice when people comming bakc at night) Nice but small bathroom - well equipped. Clean. Very nice breakfast - both cold and hot dishes, even chairs for small children. Cosy room. People at the front desk spoke english very vell. Helpfull. Not many restaurants near by. One beautiful on the Gran Via - just turn right from the hotel to the Gran Via - same sidewalk - turn right - just a few minutes to walk. Very anonymous outside - but beautiful inside. Good food, nice staff - main courses 17-27 Euro. Wine is cheap everyhwere. A short walk to Pl.Espana. Take to the right by the old bull ring - a long shoppingstreet - lots of small shops - much cheaper than in the inner city which is very expensive compared to norwegian prices. Take the city tour busses - red and blu line. The blue line from Pl. Espana (stops by the Fira building - you have to cross the plaza comming from Gran via - keep left. - than change routes at the Pl.Catalunia. This is the easy way to see all the sights in a very huge city. 18 eruo p.p. for one day - than you can use these busses the whole day - hop on/hop off. You by tickets on the bus. Taxi from airport in the evening; 25 euro - in daytime 20 euro. the room was bigger than an ordinary hotelroom - aricond. OK - lots of hot water. Not many people at the hotel when we were there - maybe thats why we didnt hear anything from next door - but walls are thin. The hotel is renovating some of the rooms - november 2006 - but no work on weekends. Can recommend this place both for grownups and families.

Reviews.Title: “Space!”
Reviews.Author: ryanc
Reviews.Content: Cracking find, this was. We paid a very decent price for a double room and had a room on the top floor with kitchen area, lounge area and a huge balcony! I'm not sure whether we were upgraded without us knowing, but it certainly was worth every penny! The rooms were basic but spotless and the breakfast was decent, too. Pretty good location, too... very close to a metro stop and only 15 minutes walk to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “good on a budget”
Reviews.Author: hergest
Reviews.Content: just got back from 6 nights at aparthotel calabria and overall i must say that it was a decent place to stop for the price. Rooms were kept clean, breakfast was good, location was quite good aswell. The kitchen was good for the main reason that it had a fridge and staff on the whole were friendly and helpful except for one stroppy bat in reception that we had an altercation with on the last day over the deposit on the safe she claimed that she had no record of us paying! The big let down,as has been mentioned a few times in other reviews, was the noise. We were on the main road side where a building is being constructed, so from 7.45 every morning we were woken by the workers! The hotel can't be blamed for this but i would suggest better quality windows be fitted. The walls are also paper thin and every noise from neighbouring rooms can be heard.

Reviews.Title: “barcelona bargain”
Reviews.Author: bargainal
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed at this hotel for 4 days I can confirm it to be a real bargain if you can bag yourself a special internet price. The location is extremely easy to get to using airport bus to Placa Espanya,Metro 2 stops to Urgell ,Hotel 100 yards. The area was very quiet and safe. we were lucky to get an apartment on the top floor with a huge balcony nice to sit out on with a bottle of wine last thing at night after a hard days sight seeing. There are 2 supermarkets next door but I wouldn't advise cooking on the rings in the apartment as found them very slow to heat up as other reviews have mentioned, however there are a couple of super take away deli's near by. Other reviews mention it being noisey in the rooms, we didnt find this so. The apartment itself was huge with the biggest bathroom I have ever seen in my life complete with all the toiletries you could wish for including shaving set and comb. Whilst it was very clean it has to be said it was a little shabby in parts but that didnt bother us. The included breakfast is very substantial with a huge choice allowing you to completly skip your lunch. Check out is at noon but if you have a later flight out the hotel has a room for you to keep your cases in to collect when you want allowing you complete freedom of movement on your last day. Would definately use this hotel again if we came back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Can be better”
Reviews.Author: Roses_bud
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from 14 to 16th April. Here are the good and bad things that we found in the hotel. Pros: 1. Friendly staff/speak english 2. Good location, near Metro Rocafort and supermarket. 3. Great breakfast 4. Big rooms equipped with a kitchenette. 5. Good value for money. cons: 1.Hotel had a foul smell!!!(due to pesticide)???? 2.Rooms can get very noisy at times, since the wall are thin, we were often awaken in the middle of the night 3. Rooms were NOT spotless clean, one of the towel had nose [--] on it and were folded carefully for us to use!! Bedsheets were not washed properly, one can clearly see some stain on it. Also bathroom roof had funguss on it!!!! 4. There was only 1 coffee machine, which resulted in a long queue in the breakfast room! 5. Breakfast starts late in our opinion during weekends at 8am ( while others start at 6am)as a result we missed 1 days breakfast, since we had to catch a bus tour to Montserrat at 8.30! There are few chances that I might stay there again but if i do, then I will defintely avoid room no 211!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Atenea Calabria Apartaments
HotelInfo.Address: Calabria 129-131, 08015 Barcelona, Spain
